articles.title: Royal commission hears Australian disability enterprise workers paid as little as $2.50 an hour - ABC News
articles.description: The disability royal commission is examining the experiences of people who have worked in Australian disability enterprises, as advocates raise concerns about low wages.
articles.content:
Victorian man Greg Tucker has been doing manual work for the past two years, packing nappies in a warehouse.
For his efforts, he has been paid $2.50 an hour.

articles.title: Australia's unemployment rate of 4 per cent is good news that should get even better by polling day - ABC News
articles.description: While there has been much talk of Anthony Albanese's campaign stumble, the more extraordinary thing is that unemployment is actually set to fall below 4 per cent — and a 60-year low of 3 per cent is now within sight, writes Peter Martin.

When Labor leader Anthony Albanese couldn't say whether the unemployment rate was 5 per cent or 4 per cent on Monday, he might have had a point.
